results.firPara: Todays fluff is clinging to a lamppost singing Yesterday
results.secPara: Todays fluff is clinging to a lamppost singing Yesterday
results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Manchester City to swoop for Celta Vigo's Nolito?

results.firPara: Test your knowledge of clashes between English and Welsh teams and managers

The Sweden midfielder Albin Ekdal has praised Giorgio Chiellini for looking after him while both played for Juventus, but added the Italy centre-back likes to influence referees and can be a swine on the pitch.
results.secPara: Sweden and Italy meet in Group E in Toulouse on Friday with Ekdal coming up against two former team-mates from his time in Turin in Chiellini and Gianluigi Buffon. The Swede joined Juventus in 2008 and, while he has only praise for the Italians for how they treated him as a youngster at the club, he knows they adopt a completely different mentality once they step on the pitch.
results.webTitle: Sweden’s Albin Ekdal: ‘Giorgio Chiellini can be a swine on the pitch’

results.firPara: French riot police use teargas to disperse fans from citys main square, with dozens arrested and 16 people taken to hospital over course of the day
results.secPara: French riot police use teargas to disperse fans from citys main square, with dozens arrested and 16 people taken to hospital over course of the day
results.webTitle: Euro 2016: dozens arrested in Lille after England and Russia supporters clash

results.firPara: Didier Deschamps rang the changes for France and admitted afterwards that Paul Pogba and Antoine Griezmann were unhappy about being dropped to the substitutes bench for their teams victory over Albania. Griezmann came on to tilt the game with a goal in the 90th minute, before Dimitri Payet added a second to send France into the last 16.
results.secPara: I know he is not happy, nor is Paul Pogba, said Deschamps, although he remained adamant his choices were made with the teams progress in mind. Paul Pogba was more of a tactical decision, the manager explained. With that system I thought we needed two real scrappers in the middle of the park. Paul has different attributes. As for Griezmann, I am managing him. He is doing well but he had a busy season and we have three games in nine days. He made the difference even though I know he would have preferred to have started the game.
results.webTitle: Didier Deschamps says France’s Paul Pogba was unhappy to be dropped

results.firPara: A total of 36 people have been arrested in Lille following clashes earlier this evening and tonight, according to the the police.
results.secPara: Were going to wrap it up now at this end as things appear to have calmed down in Lille.
results.webTitle: Riot police charge England fans as fresh violence hits Euro 2016 - as it happened

results.firPara: • Welsh provocation cuts no ice with England manager and Wayne Rooney
results.secPara: Roy Hodgson has insisted his England players would feel ashamed if they allowed themselves to be distracted by Wales provocative rhetoric before the teams eagerly anticipated meeting at Stade Bollaert-Delelis and has dismissed the talk as cheap.
results.webTitle: Roy Hodgson tells Wales ‘talk is cheap’ before crucial Euro 2016 game

results.firPara: Slovakian centre-half seeks to revive club career in Turkey after falling out of favour with Jürgen Klopp following eight years at Anfield
results.secPara: Liverpools long-serving defender Martin Skrtel is close to agreeing a £5.5m move to Fenerbahce. The Slovakia international signed a new three-year contract at Anfield last summer but has accepted his eight-year career on Merseyside is over having fallen out of favour under Jürgen Klopp.
results.webTitle: Martin Skrtel set to end Liverpool career as Fenerbahce line up £5.5m deal

results.firPara: Chris Coleman is relishing what he expects to be a domestic style 100mph dust up when Wales play England on Thursday .
results.secPara: The manager led his side to a 2-1 victory in their opener against Slovakia while Roy Hodgsons team could manage only a 1-1 draw with Russia.
results.webTitle: Chris Coleman relishing ‘100mph dust-up’ when Wales play England

results.firPara: The new Aston Villa owner, Tony Jiantong Xia, describes himself as a patient man and sees no reason why the club should not be winning European Cups again in 10 years.
results.secPara: Villas first task will be to regain Premier League status, to which end the Chinese businessman Xia has recruited not only Roberto Di Matteo as manager but Steve Clarke and Kevin Bond as assistants. It is really important to gain promotion as soon as we can, ideally in the first season, Xia said on presenting his new management team which, subject to Football League ratification, will also include the former Everton chief executive Keith Wyness as CEO.
results.webTitle: Roberto Di Matteo and Tony Xia insist Aston Villa will rise again
